data.title: Craigie House, Cambridge, Massachusetts, ca. 1920
data.meta_description: This Spode plate displays the Craigie House in Cambridge, Massachusetts.  The poet Henry Wadsworth Longfellow moved into this house as a boarder in 1837.  Six years later, he married Frances (Fanny) Appleton.  Her father had purchased Craigie House, and gave it to the couple as a wedding gift.  Longfellow lived there until his death in 1882.
data.text:
Contributed by Maine Historical Society

Description

This Spode plate displays the Craigie House in Cambridge, Massachusetts. The poet Henry Wadsworth Longfellow moved into this house as a boarder in 1837. Six years later, he married Frances (Fanny) Appleton. Her father had purchased Craigie House, and gave it to the couple as a wedding gift. Longfellow lived there until his death in 1882.
